actions.args: {"id": 0, "body": {"name": "ETHSeoul 2024 bounty payouts", "summary": "This is a proposal that covers the bounty payouts for Near bounties at ETHSeoul hackathon", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "APPROVED", "sponsor_requested_review": true, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "rimberjack.near", "description": "[ETH Seoul](https://ethseoul2024.devfolio.co/projects) is a 3 day hackathon that took place in Pangyo, South Korea. Organized by KryptoSeoul, Ludium, and Dystopia Labs, ETH Seoul started in 2022. Now it is an annual showcase of a vibrant builder community. Near offered $30k in prizes and chose 6 winners among 47 submitted projects:\\\\n\\\\n- DeFi Brain\\\\n- Connor AI\\\\n- Agent Smith\\\\n- Sealeon\\\\n- Gajami\\\\n- Illusion Blaze\\\\n\\\\nI\\\\\\'m requesting $USDT 30000 to administed the bounty payouts through NEAR Heroes platform. Each winning team will get from $3000 to $10000 according to their hackathon placement.\\\\n\\\\n[This expense was approved](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1oGb1q6yUhFq6Lc3V3fvy7Wnqg91yGcTZ0NNhM8mFIbI/edit?usp=sharing) by the Events Committee within the NEAR DevHub Q2 budget proposal on April 19th, 2024.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "devhub-payouts.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "30000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Bounty"]}

{"id": 1, "body": {"name": "ETHBerlin + BREW Conference Coding Session Proposal ", "summary": "NEAR presence at Berlin Blockchain Week: Brew Berlin sponsorship including a workshop and a coding session + support at ETHBerlin hackathon", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "APPROVED", "sponsor_requested_review": true, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "rimberjack.near", "description": "This is more than a usual hackathon sponsorship. This proposal includes:\\\\n- Having a code workshop at BREW 1 day prior to the ETHBerlin hackathon start\\\\n- Making teams build on NEAR at the ETHBerlin Hackathon (incentivize them with bounty booster)\\\\n\\\\n**Why BREW?**\\\\n- Research & Dev Focused Chain Agnostic Event\\\\n- 1 day prior to ETHBerlin\\\\n- 250 visitors expected\\\\n- Berlin Native - involved with local web3 developer community for +7 years\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n1. Event Overview\\\\nTitle: ETHBerlin activation\\\\nDate & Format: 24.05.2024 In-Person\\\\nLocation: BREW conference for Coding Session & ETHBerlin Hackathon\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n2. Attending Team\\\\nMaria Magdalena Neu @mariamneu.near\\\\nMaria Yarotska @yarotska.near\\\\nBoris Polania @bpolania.near\\\\nSupporting: Mintbase local community members\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n3. Event Objectives\\\\nGoals: Engage Developers to build their ETHBerlin hacks on Near. Effectively Dev Acquisition & Retention\\\\nTarget Audience: Developers that will be attending ETHBerlin Hackathon. Obviously looking for Rust developers, but also calling in Solidity and AI interested devs.\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n4. Challenges & Themes\\\\nThe Coding Session will be led by @bpolania.near from NEAR DevHub. We are aiming to get a room for 2 hours where teams will first learn about possibilities on NEAR and then be incentivized to submit something. Each Submission (each TEAM) will be rewarded with 150USD.\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n\\\\n5. Schedule  \\\\nThe activation at BREW - which happens 1 day prior to ETHBERLIN - is supposed to make teams familiar with building on NEAR. Getting them familiar with all we have to offer.\\\\nIllia will hopefully be able to speak on the main stage and call devs to the workshop hosted in the afternoon at the same location, where they will learn and do a mini-hack activity. \\\\nFor these activities there\\\\u{2019}s the possibility to include Mintbase Templates (getting them involved), using Minsta. \\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n**Key Activities: **\\\\nBREW, as mentioned, is a chain agnostic 1 day long conference that happens very close to the ETHBerlin location on the day prior to ETHBerlin start. They have Polygon as the other speciality sponsor - their main narrative is AI & Near would be focusing on chain abstraction.\\\\nOur workshop is planned in the afternoon at which the following themes will be talked about:\\\\n- presentation of the bounty booster\\\\n- hacking chain abstraction on Near\\\\n- mintbase Templates / mintbase wallet (supports ETH too)\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n6. KPIs and Impact\\\\nKey Performance Indicators:\\\\n- Workshop attendees \\\\u{2013} 50 people\\\\n- Workshop Submissions \\\\u{2013} 10 submissions\\\\n- ETHBerlin on Near Submissions \\\\u{2013} 10 submissions\\\\n- ETHBerlin Hackathon winners which built on NEAR \\\\u{2013} 1 winner\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\nCommunity Impact: \\\\n- Visibility to what\\\\u{2019}s possible on NEAR in contrast to what isn\\\\u{2019}t yet on other layer ones \\\\n- Chain Abstraction on Near expansion \\\\n- New startups funneled into NEAR HZN\\\\n\\\\n7. Budget and Funding\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\nBudget Breakdown: see [Budget Link](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1OB4K3q-LAVOOEGuqExDMb0H2LlF4pXH_Z7mjXzcb2Mc/edit?usp=sharing)\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\nTotal Funding Requested: 23334 EUR\\\\nRequested prior to event: $19,635 (excluding submission incentives and bounty booster)\\\\n\\\\n8. Bounties and Prizes\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\nDetails: submission incentive (max 20 x 150 USD), bounty booster for ETHBerlin separate\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n9. Marketing and Promotion\\\\nThe hackathon at ETHBerlin does not need promotion. The coding session will be to promote NEAR to be used at the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n10. Contact Information\\\\nContact Details: mariamneu telegram / mariamagneu twitter/ neumariamagdalena@gmail.com email \\\\n\\\\nSponsorship Deal with BREW Berlin: Speciality Sponsor custom package (initial price $20k)\\\\n\\\\nOur adjustments:\\\\n \\\\u{2043} Roundtable and panel discussion will be taken out \\\\n \\\\u{2043} Workshop time will be increased to 2 hours total \\\\n \\\\u{2043} $5k discount", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "devhub-payouts.nea", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "19635", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Event sponsorship", "Hackbox"]}

{"body": {"name": "AI CHAIN NEAR TUNISIA HACKATHON ", "summary": "AI CHAIN NEAR TUNISIA HACKATHON is a 2 weeks hacking session for those who want to team up,  developing innovative AI solutions on Web3, get familiar with NEAR, build a prototype for their project, pitch it, and get a chance to win.\\\\nThe hackathon can be the start of something amazing, or a way to fail fast, learn, and adapt. We appreciate both, because we know that to build the next big thing you often have to fail enough times to find just the right idea.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "# 1. Hackathon Overview\\\\n**Title: AI CHAIN NEAR HACKATHON Tunisia\\\\n**Date & Format: 01/06/2024, Hybrid\\\\nLocation: Elaco coworking Space, Hackbox\\\\n# 2. Organizing Team\\\\nOrganizers:\\\\nAmira Nasri: CFO of Elaco Coworking Space/ Web3 Developer\\\\nMed Habib Hermi: Graphic Designer/ Vice president IEEE club\\\\nPartnerships: Elaco Coworking Space, IEEE ISTIC\\\\n# 3. Event Objectives\\\\n**Goals:\\\\n**\\\\u{27a2} Foster a sense of community among developers, entrepreneurs, and blockchain enthusiasts interested in AI and NEAR blockchain on Tunisia and north Africa.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Provide participants with the opportunity to enhance their skills in blockchain development, AI integration, and smart contract deployment.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Contribute to the growth and expansion of the NEAR ecosystem by attracting new developers and projects to the platform.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Creation of new solutions that address real-world problems in areas such as finance, healthcare, supply chain, and more, using AI and NEAR blockchain.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Networking Opportunities.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Development of seed projects with the potential for further funding, incubation, or commercialization.\\\\n**Target Audience:\\\\n**Developers, Blockchain Enthusiasts, AI Enthusiasts, Students, Entrepreneurs, Tech Startups, Investors, funding organizations interested in supporting innovative projects in the blockchain and AI space, Academic Researchers\\\\n# 4. Challenges & Themes\\\\n**# Details: Participants can choose from a variety of challenges that combine AI and NEAR blockchain, including but not limited to:\\\\n**\\\\no AI for Smart Contracts\\\\no Decentralized AI Marketplaces\\\\no AI-Powered Blockchain Analytics\\\\no AI-Based Identity Verification\\\\no AI-Driven Governance\\\\no AI for Tokenomics\\\\no AI-Powered Fraud Detection\\\\no AI for Supply Chain Optimization\\\\no AI-Driven Social Impact\\\\no AI-Based NFT Marketplaces\\\\no AI-Powered Decentralized Exchanges**\\\\n# 5. Schedule and Activities\\\\n**# Duration:\\\\n**1 day at Elaco coworking Space, 2 weeks online\\\\n   From 19 /04/2024 To 01/05/2024\\\\n**Key Activities:**\\\\n12/05/2024: Workshop 1 online:\\\\no Introduction to NEAR Protocol and AI Integration\\\\n 19/05/2024: Workshop 2 online:\\\\no Building Smart Contracts with AI\\\\no Team Formation and Idea Pitching\\\\no Launch Hack Session\\\\n01/06/2024: Mini Hackathon at Elaco Coworking Space\\\\no 8:00 am - 9:00 am: Registration and Check-in\\\\no 9:00 am - 9:30 am: Welcome Address and Event Overview\\\\no 9:30 am - 10:00 am: Keynote Speech on AI and Blockchain\\\\no 10:00 am - 11:00 am: Idea Pitching\\\\no 11:00 am - 12:00 pm: Lunch Break\\\\no 12:00 pm - 1:00 pm: Mentoring Sessions\\\\no 1:00 pm - 4:00 pm: Hacking Session: Project Development+++++\\\\no 3:00 pm - 4:00 pm: Submission Deadline\\\\no 4:00 pm - 5:00 pm: Project Presentations\\\\no 5:00 pm - 6:00 pm: Judging Session\\\\no 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm: Awards Ceremony and Closing Remarks\\\\nActivities:\\\\no Workshops: Conduct workshops on NEAR Protocol, AI integration, smart contract development, and other relevant topics to help participants learn new skills and tools.\\\\no Hacking Sessions: Provide dedicated time for participants to work on their projects with support from mentors and experts.\\\\no Mentoring Sessions: Offer one-on-one mentoring sessions to help participants with project development, problem-solving, and technical guidance.\\\\no Project Presentations: Allow participants to showcase their projects to a panel of judges and the audience, highlighting the use of AI and NEAR blockchain.\\\\no Awards Ceremony: Announce the winners of the hackathon and award prizes  for the best projects in various categories.\\\\n# 6. KPIs and Impact\\\\n**Key Performance Indicators:\\\\n**o Number of Participants: 60 persons\\\\no Project Submissions: 4 - 8 projects\\\\no Social Media Engagement: Track social media metrics such as likes, shares, and comments to gauge online engagement and reach.\\\\no Feedback and Surveys: 60 feedback from participants, judges, sponsors, and partners through surveys to identify areas for improvement and measure satisfaction levels.\\\\nCommunity Impact:\\\\no The hackathon will foster collaboration and knowledge sharing among developers, AI enthusiasts, and blockchain experts, strengthening the local and global NEAR communities.\\\\no By encouraging the use of NEAR Protocol for AI applications, the hackathon will contribute to the growth and expansion of the NEAR ecosystem, attracting new developers and innovative projects to the platform.\\\\n**Budget Breakdown\\\\n**Products Item Qty for 60 participants Total Price\\\\nMarketing:\\\\n\\\\u{25aa} Rollup (100x200 cm)\\\\n\\\\u{25aa} Social Media Ads\\\\n100 $\\\\nFood and Refreshments:\\\\n\\\\u{25aa} Welcome coffee\\\\n\\\\u{25aa} Lunch\\\\n\\\\u{25aa} Happy hour\\\\n1200 $\\\\nSwag and Merchandise:\\\\n\\\\u{25aa} T-shirts\\\\n60 600 $\\\\n# **Total Funding Requested: 1900 $**\\\\n# 7. Bounties and Prizes\\\\nDetails:\\\\n\\\\u{2022} First Place Prize: 500 USDC\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Second Place Prize: 350 USDC\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Third Place Prize: 250 USDC\\\\n# 8. Judging Criteria\\\\nEvaluation Process:\\\\nQuality of the Idea: Includes creativity and originality of the idea.\\\\nImplementation of the Idea: Includes how well the idea was executed by the\\\\ndeveloper.\\\\nPotential Value to Businesses\\\\nIncludes the extent to which the app can help businesses grow.\\\\nUsability (User Experience and Design)\\\\nIs your project user-friendly? Does it have a clean and intuitive interface? A great\\\\nproject is not only about what it does, but also how it does it. We appreciate good\\\\ndesign and attention to detail.\\\\n# 9. Marketing and Promotion\\\\nStrategy:\\\\nPromotion Strategy: Plan for Promoting the Hackathon\\\\n Start promoting the hackathon at least 2-3 weeks before the event date on:\\\\no Social media ADS.\\\\no Events and Workshops: Organize workshops and webinars, to generate interestand provide valuable insights into the hackathon themes and technologies.\\\\no Email Marketing.\\\\no Ramp up promotion efforts in the weeks leading to the event, focusing on\\\\nregistration deadlines and key announcements.\\\\no Partnerships: Collaborate with universities, tech companies, and community \\\\n\\\\n# 10. Contact Information\\\\nContact Details:\\\\nAmira Nasri\\\\no Telegram: https://t.me/amiranasri\\\\no Tel: +216 97700648\\\\no LinkedIn : https://www.linkedin.com/in/amira-nasri-135582112/\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "alae.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1900", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Hackbox", "Event sponsorship"]}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @alae.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}AI CHAIN NEAR TUNISIA HACKATHON \\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAI CHAIN NEAR TUNISIA HACKATHON is a 2 weeks hacking session for those who want to team up,  developing innovative AI solutions on Web3, get familiar with NEAR, build a prototype for their project, pitch it, and get a chance to win.\\\\\\\\nThe hackathon can be the start of something amazing, or a way to fail fast, learn, and adapt. We appreciate both, because we know that to build the next big thing you often have to fail enough times to find just the right idea.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=4)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"body": {"name": "AI CHAIN NEAR TUNISIA HACKATHON [Hackbox - 2024] | #PoweredByHackbox", "summary": "#PoweredByHackbox: NEAR Tunisia is proud to organise 2 weeks hacking session online and 1 day in ELACO Coworking Space for those who want to team up,  developing innovative AI solutions on Web3, get familiar with NEAR, build a prototype for their project, pitch it, and get a chance to win.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "AI CHAIN NEAR TUNISIA HACKATHON [Hackbox - 2024] | #PoweredByHackbox\\\\nRequested amount: $1900\\\\n\\\\nI am pleased to confirm that after applying through the official Hackbox intake form and undergoing the screening process by the Hackbox Team @yarotska.near and @nneoma.near, our team has been accepted into Hackbox MAI 2024\\\\n\\\\n**1. Hackathon Overview\\\\n\\\\nTitle: AI CHAIN NEAR HACKATHON Tunisia\\\\nDate & Format: \\\\nOnline May 19th - 31st\\\\nIn-Person June 1st \\\\nLocation: Elaco coworking Space Tunisia\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**2. Organizing Team\\\\n\\\\nAmira Nasri: CFO of Elaco Coworking Space/ Web3 Developer\\\\nMed Habib Hermi: Graphic Designer/ Vice president IEEE club\\\\nPartnerships: Elaco Coworking Space, IEEE ISTIC\\\\n\\\\n**3. Event Objectives\\\\n\\\\nGoals:\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Foster a sense of community among developers, entrepreneurs, and blockchain enthusiasts interested in AI and NEAR blockchain on Tunisia and north Africa.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Provide participants with the opportunity to enhance their skills in blockchain development, AI integration, and smart contract deployment.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Contribute to the growth and expansion of the NEAR ecosystem by attracting new developers and projects to the platform.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Creation of new solutions that address real-world problems in areas such as finance, healthcare, supply chain, and more, using AI and NEAR blockchain.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Networking Opportunities.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Development of seed projects with the potential for further funding, incubation, or commercialization.\\\\n\\\\nTarget Audience:\\\\nDevelopers, Blockchain Enthusiasts, AI Enthusiasts, Students, Entrepreneurs, Tech Startups, Investors, funding organizations interested in supporting innovative projects in the blockchain and AI space, Academic Researchers\\\\n\\\\n**4. Challenges & Themes\\\\n\\\\nDetails: Participants can choose from a variety of challenges that combine AI and NEAR blockchain, including but not limited to:\\\\no AI for Smart Contracts\\\\no Decentralized AI Marketplaces\\\\no AI-Powered Blockchain Analytics\\\\no AI-Based Identity Verification\\\\no AI-Driven Governance\\\\no AI for Tokenomics\\\\no AI-Powered Fraud Detection\\\\no AI for Supply Chain Optimization\\\\no AI-Driven Social Impact\\\\no AI-Based NFT Marketplaces\\\\no AI-Powered Decentralized Exchanges\\\\n\\\\n**5. Schedule and Activities\\\\n\\\\nDuration:\\\\n1 day at Elaco coworking Space, 2 weeks online\\\\nFrom 19 /04/2024 To 01/05/2024\\\\nKey Activities:\\\\n12/05/2024: Workshop 1 online:\\\\no Introduction to NEAR Protocol and AI Integration\\\\n19/05/2024: Workshop 2 online:\\\\no Building Smart Contracts with AI\\\\no Team Formation and Idea Pitching\\\\no Launch Hack Session\\\\n01/06/2024: Mini Hackathon at Elaco Coworking Space\\\\no 8:00 am - 9:00 am: Registration and Check-in\\\\no 9:00 am - 9:30 am: Welcome Address and Event Overview\\\\no 9:30 am - 10:00 am: Keynote Speech on AI and Blockchain\\\\no 10:00 am - 11:00 am: Idea Pitching\\\\no 11:00 am - 12:00 pm: Lunch Break\\\\no 12:00 pm - 1:00 pm: Mentoring Sessions\\\\no 1:00 pm - 4:00 pm: Hacking Session: Project Development+++++\\\\no 3:00 pm - 4:00 pm: Submission Deadline\\\\no 4:00 pm - 5:00 pm: Project Presentations\\\\no 5:00 pm - 6:00 pm: Judging Session\\\\no 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm: Awards Ceremony and Closing Remarks\\\\nActivities:\\\\no Workshops: Conduct workshops on NEAR Protocol, AI integration, smart contract development, and other relevant topics to help participants learn new skills and tools.\\\\no Hacking Sessions: Provide dedicated time for participants to work on their projects with support from mentors and experts.\\\\no Mentoring Sessions: Offer one-on-one mentoring sessions to help participants with project development, problem-solving, and technical guidance.\\\\no Project Presentations: Allow participants to showcase their projects to a panel of judges and the audience, highlighting the use of AI and NEAR blockchain.\\\\no Awards Ceremony: Announce the winners of the hackathon and award prizes for the best projects in various categories.\\\\n\\\\n**6. KPIs and Impact\\\\n\\\\noNumber of Participants: 60 persons\\\\no Project Submissions: 4 - 8 projects\\\\no Social Media Engagement: Track social media metrics such as likes, shares, and comments to gauge online engagement and reach.\\\\no Feedback and Surveys: 60 feedback from participants, judges, sponsors, and partners through surveys to identify areas for improvement and measure satisfaction levels.\\\\n\\\\nCommunity Impact:\\\\no The hackathon will foster collaboration and knowledge sharing among developers, AI enthusiasts, and blockchain experts, strengthening the local and global NEAR communities.\\\\no By encouraging the use of NEAR Protocol for AI applications, the hackathon will contribute to the growth and expansion of the NEAR ecosystem, attracting new developers and innovative projects to the platform.\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Breakdown\\\\n\\\\nITEM\\\\t                             QTY            \\\\tCOST($)\\\\t                     COST ($)\\\\nSeating + Tables           \\\\t  30\\\\t                      $5                            $150\\\\nMerchandise & Swag\\\\t    60\\\\t                    $10                            $600\\\\nFood & Drinks \\\\t              60\\\\t\\\\t                  $17                           $1020\\\\nBranding\\\\t                         1\\\\t\\\\t                    $30                             $30\\\\nMarketing & Promo     \\\\t   1\\\\t                    $100                          $100\\\\nTOTAL\\\\t\\\\t                                                   $1900\\\\n\\\\nProposal 1 Budget : https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11RvGBKhup20UDpFWecmH9T_MSyLW6P_CRzu74bg3CG4/edit?usp=sharing\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**7. Bounties and Prizes\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{2022} First Place Prize: 500 USDC\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Second Place Prize: 350 USDC\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Third Place Prize: 250 USDC\\\\n\\\\n**8. Judging Criteria\\\\n\\\\nEvaluation Process:\\\\n- Quality of the Idea: Includes creativity and originality of the idea.\\\\n- Implementation of the Idea: Includes how well the idea was executed by the developer.\\\\n- Usability (User Experience and Design): Is your project user-friendly? Does it have a clean and intuitive interface? A great project is not only about what it does, but also how it does it. We appreciate good design and attention to detail.\\\\n\\\\n**9. {"proposal": {"id": 5, "snapshot": {"name": "AI CHAIN NEAR TUNISIA HACKATHON [Hackbox - 2024] | #PoweredByHackbox", "labels": ["Hackathon", "Hackbox"], "summary": "#PoweredByHackbox: NEAR Tunisia is proud to organise 2 weeks hacking session online and 1 day in ELACO Coworking Space for those who want to team up,  developing innovative AI solutions on Web3, get familiar with NEAR, build a prototype for their project, pitch it, and get a chance to win.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "alae.near", "timestamp": "1715790719530662742", "supervisor": null, "description": "AI CHAIN NEAR TUNISIA HACKATHON [Hackbox - 2024] | #PoweredByHackbox\\\\nRequested amount: $1900\\\\n\\\\nI am pleased to confirm that after applying through the official Hackbox intake form and undergoing the screening process by the Hackbox Team @yarotska.near and @nneoma.near, our team has been accepted into Hackbox MAI 2024\\\\n\\\\n**1. Hackathon Overview\\\\n\\\\nTitle: AI CHAIN NEAR HACKATHON Tunisia\\\\nDate & Format: \\\\nOnline May 19th - 31st\\\\nIn-Person June 1st \\\\nLocation: Elaco coworking Space Tunisia\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**2. Organizing Team\\\\n\\\\nAmira Nasri: CFO of Elaco Coworking Space/ Web3 Developer\\\\nMed Habib Hermi: Graphic Designer/ Vice president IEEE club\\\\nPartnerships: Elaco Coworking Space, IEEE ISTIC\\\\n\\\\n**3. Event Objectives\\\\n\\\\nGoals:\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Foster a sense of community among developers, entrepreneurs, and blockchain enthusiasts interested in AI and NEAR blockchain on Tunisia and north Africa.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Provide participants with the opportunity to enhance their skills in blockchain development, AI integration, and smart contract deployment.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Contribute to the growth and expansion of the NEAR ecosystem by attracting new developers and projects to the platform.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Creation of new solutions that address real-world problems in areas such as finance, healthcare, supply chain, and more, using AI and NEAR blockchain.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Networking Opportunities.\\\\n\\\\u{27a2} Development of seed projects with the potential for further funding, incubation, or commercialization.\\\\n\\\\nTarget Audience:\\\\nDevelopers, Blockchain Enthusiasts, AI Enthusiasts, Students, Entrepreneurs, Tech Startups, Investors, funding organizations interested in supporting innovative projects in the blockchain and AI space, Academic Researchers\\\\n\\\\n**4. Challenges & Themes\\\\n\\\\nDetails: Participants can choose from a variety of challenges that combine AI and NEAR blockchain, including but not limited to:\\\\no AI for Smart Contracts\\\\no Decentralized AI Marketplaces\\\\no AI-Powered Blockchain Analytics\\\\no AI-Based Identity Verification\\\\no AI-Driven Governance\\\\no AI for Tokenomics\\\\no AI-Powered Fraud Detection\\\\no AI for Supply Chain Optimization\\\\no AI-Driven Social Impact\\\\no AI-Based NFT Marketplaces\\\\no AI-Powered Decentralized Exchanges\\\\n\\\\n**5. Schedule and Activities\\\\n\\\\nDuration:\\\\n1 day at Elaco coworking Space, 2 weeks online\\\\nFrom 19 /04/2024 To 01/05/2024\\\\nKey Activities:\\\\n12/05/2024: Workshop 1 online:\\\\no Introduction to NEAR Protocol and AI Integration\\\\n19/05/2024: Workshop 2 online:\\\\no Building Smart Contracts with AI\\\\no Team Formation and Idea Pitching\\\\no Launch Hack Session\\\\n01/06/2024: Mini Hackathon at Elaco Coworking Space\\\\no 8:00 am - 9:00 am: Registration and Check-in\\\\no 9:00 am - 9:30 am: Welcome Address and Event Overview\\\\no 9:30 am - 10:00 am: Keynote Speech on AI and Blockchain\\\\no 10:00 am - 11:00 am: Idea Pitching\\\\no 11:00 am - 12:00 pm: Lunch Break\\\\no 12:00 pm - 1:00 pm: Mentoring Sessions\\\\no 1:00 pm - 4:00 pm: Hacking Session: Project Development+++++\\\\no 3:00 pm - 4:00 pm: Submission Deadline\\\\no 4:00 pm - 5:00 pm: Project Presentations\\\\no 5:00 pm - 6:00 pm: Judging Session\\\\no 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm: Awards Ceremony and Closing Remarks\\\\nActivities:\\\\no Workshops: Conduct workshops on NEAR Protocol, AI integration, smart contract development, and other relevant topics to help participants learn new skills and tools.\\\\no Hacking Sessions: Provide dedicated time for participants to work on their projects with support from mentors and experts.\\\\no Mentoring Sessions: Offer one-on-one mentoring sessions to help participants with project development, problem-solving, and technical guidance.\\\\no Project Presentations: Allow participants to showcase their projects to a panel of judges and the audience, highlighting the use of AI and NEAR blockchain.\\\\no Awards Ceremony: Announce the winners of the hackathon and award prizes for the best projects in various categories.\\\\n\\\\n**6. KPIs and Impact\\\\n\\\\noNumber of Participants: 60 persons\\\\no Project Submissions: 4 - 8 projects\\\\no Social Media Engagement: Track social media metrics such as likes, shares, and comments to gauge online engagement and reach.\\\\no Feedback and Surveys: 60 feedback from participants, judges, sponsors, and partners through surveys to identify areas for improvement and measure satisfaction levels.\\\\n\\\\nCommunity Impact:\\\\no The hackathon will foster collaboration and knowledge sharing among developers, AI enthusiasts, and blockchain experts, strengthening the local and global NEAR communities.\\\\no By encouraging the use of NEAR Protocol for AI applications, the hackathon will contribute to the growth and expansion of the NEAR ecosystem, attracting new developers and innovative projects to the platform.\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Breakdown\\\\n\\\\nITEM\\\\t                             QTY            \\\\tCOST($)\\\\t                     COST ($)\\\\nSeating + Tables           \\\\t  30\\\\t                      $5                            $150\\\\nMerchandise & Swag\\\\t    60\\\\t                    $10                            $600\\\\nFood & Drinks \\\\t              60\\\\t\\\\t                  $17                           $1020\\\\nBranding\\\\t                         1\\\\t\\\\t                    $30                             $30\\\\nMarketing & Promo     \\\\t   1\\\\t                    $100                          $100\\\\nTOTAL\\\\t\\\\t                                                   $1900\\\\n\\\\nProposal 1 Budget : https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11RvGBKhup20UDpFWecmH9T_MSyLW6P_CRzu74bg3CG4/edit?usp=sharing\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**7. Bounties and Prizes\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{2022} First Place Prize: 500 USDC\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Second Place Prize: 350 USDC\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Third Place Prize: 250 USDC\\\\n\\\\n**8.
